citations.narrative:
On July 25, 2024, a search was conducted at the facility because it was suspected that the owner was conducting
regulated activity without a license. On May 27, 2024, the facility had posted on social media a picture of a racoon that
they had sold. There were no racoons present at the facility at the time of the search, but the owner of the facility admitted
he had bought the racoon from a breeder and then sold the racoon as a pet. On the day of the search the facility also had
22 adult hedgehogs which included 14 females and 5 baby hedgehogs. The owner is licensed with the state as a pet
store and animal dealer and does sell hedgehogs raised on the premises. The facility also has 8 breeding age dogs
whose puppies are sold in face-to-face sales with buyers.
Selling a racoon as a pet and selling hedgehogs raised on the premises if there are more than four breeding female
animals are activities that require a valid license under the Animal Welfare Act. A license must be obtained prior to
conducting further regulated activity.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.1(a)(1) 
   
Requirements and application. 
On July 25, 2024, a search was conducted at the facility because it was suspected that the owner was conducting 
regulated activity without a license. On May 27, 2024, the facility had posted on social media a picture of a racoon that 
they had sold. There were no racoons present at the facility at the time of the search, but the owner of the facility admitted 
he had bought the racoon from a breeder and then sold the racoon as a pet. On the day of the search the facility also had 
22 adult hedgehogs which included 14 females and 5 baby hedgehogs. The owner is licensed with the state as a pet 
store and animal dealer and does sell hedgehogs raised on the premises. The facility also has 8 breeding age dogs 
whose puppies are sold in face-to-face sales with buyers. 
Selling a racoon as a pet and selling hedgehogs raised on the premises if there are more than four breeding female 
animals are activities that require a valid license under the Animal Welfare Act. A license must be obtained prior to 
conducting further regulated activity. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
